Incident.Summary: The suspect was found to possess a personal use amount of Cannabis during a traffic stop.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: No MVR equipped in CE-217 and no Body-Worn Camera issued. SCENE PROCESSING: A Probable Cause Search of the suspects vehicle was conducted during a traffic stop. The search revealed six (6) commercial retail envelopes and two (2) plastic bags containing suspected cannabis. The Cannabis was consolidated into a single retail envelope and placed into a separate Ziploc plastic bag. The contents of the envelope were emptied into the larger Ziploc bag during processing. A check of Maryland Secure Case Search revealed no prior civil CDS violations. PHYSICAL EVIDENCE: The below captioned CDS was seized and stored at MSP College Park Barrack Q under Property Record # P-341147. An MSP Form 67 (Chain of Custody) was completed and attached to the CDS, which was packaged and stored in accordance with MSP policy. Item A) One (1) plastic bag containing suspected cannabis and retail bag, Weight: 23.4 grams (Includes both bags), P-341147. NARRATIVE: On March 16, 2023, I, S/T S. DiToto #5416 assisted by S/T D. Buckalew #5687, was conducting proactive enforcement in the operational area of College Park Barrack in Prince Georges County, Maryland, while operating MSP unmarked vehicle CE-217. At approximately 1630 hours, we observed a gray 2005 Nissan Sentra, Maryland Registration 7FD2540, traveling in front of our patrol vehicle in lane one on southbound MD RT 410 in the area of B W Parkway (I-295), Riverdale, Prince Georges County, Maryland. The driver was observed to not be restrained by a seatbelt as he was leaning to the side and his strap/buckler were lying loose at the B pillar of the vehicle. The driver was also observed to be holding and operating with his right hand a smart phone with an illuminated screen, which was visible as he held it up in the center console area between both seats and level with his head. I activated my vehicles emergency equipment and conducted a traffic stop. I contacted the driver, who I identified by his Maryland drivers license as George Nnazimuzo Anele (B/M, DOB: 09/13/2004) of Riverdale, Maryland. Upon contact, I detected the odor of Cannabis (marijuana) emitting from the vehicle and I asked Anele if he possessed any to which he responded that he had about six grams. I had Anele exit his vehicle and I conducted a Probable Cause Search of the car. The search revealed six (6) commercial retail envelopes and two (2) plastic bags containing suspected cannabis located within the vehicle. I combined the contents of all bags into one singular commercial retail envelope and placed that envelope inside a plastic Ziploc bag. The CDS was identified as Cannabis (marijuana) a Controlled Dangerous Substance of Schedule I by my training, knowledge, and experience as a Maryland State Trooper, as well as by the suspects statements. I observed the amount of Cannabis to be within the personal use amount according to current Maryland guidelines. I issued Anele a Uniform Civil Citation (#6Z42233071) for CDS: Civil Possession Cannabis (Personal Amount) and a copy is attached to this report. Anele was issued a Traffic Violation Warning for the observed violations and released from the scene without incident. A vehicle search report was completed and submitted in the Delta+ Program in accordance with policy. Case closed, non-criminal. Above events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland.

IncidentProperty.Description: A) One (1) plastic bag containing suspected cannabis and retail sale envelope, Weight: 23.4 grams (Including Bags), P-341147
